If there are other major uses of GNOME (besides packaging with popular/successful/significant distros), then that would be interesting; please DO mention them here. -->

GNOME is the default desktop environment for several Linux distributions, most notably [[Debian]], [[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora]] and [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]]. [[Foresight Linux]] showcases the latest releases of GNOME.
+
GNOME is the default desktop environment for several Linux distributions, most notably [[Debian]], [[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora]] and [[Ubuntu (operating system)|ubuntu]]. [[Foresight Linux]] showcases the latest releases of GNOME.
''For derived and other distributions, see [[Comparison of Linux distributions#Features|Comparison of Linux distributions]] and [[Comparison of Linux LiveDistros#Comparison|Comparison of Linux LiveDistros]].''
''For derived and other distributions, see [[Comparison of Linux distributions#Features|Comparison of Linux distributions]] and [[Comparison of Linux LiveDistros#Comparison|Comparison of Linux LiveDistros]].''
